channel.title: CyberNetSec - Security Operations
channel.description: Latest security operations threat intelligence - the last 10 articles

item.title: Over-Privileged Active Directory Domain-Join Accounts Create Major Security Risk
item.description:
A new security analysis reveals that Active Directory (AD) domain-join accounts, even when configured according to official guidance, often inherit excessive privileges that create a reliable pathway for attackers to achieve full domain compromise. These specialized accounts, used for automated mach...

Severity: High

Categories: Security Operations, Vulnerability, Threat Intelligence

item.title: LastPass Warns of Active Phishing Campaign Impersonating Brand
item.description:
Password manager LastPass issued an alert on October 13, 2025, about an active phishing campaign targeting its users. The attackers are sending emails from a fraudulent domain with subject lines like "We Have Been Hacked," creating a false sense of urgency to trick users into clicking a malicious li...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Phishing, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Discord Denies Massive Breach Claim After Hackers Allege 1.5TB Data Leak
item.description:
Discord is publicly denying claims that it suffered a major data breach. On October 11, 2025, an unknown group of hackers alleged they had exfiltrated and leaked 1.5 terabytes of user data, including highly sensitive government-issued identification documents. Some reports suggested the breach was l...

Severity: Medium

Categories: Data Breach, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Financial Firms Tie CEO Pay to Cyber Performance Amid Budget Hikes, Moody's Finds
item.description:
A new report from Moody's indicates a significant shift in how financial and insurance firms are managing cyber risk. Companies are increasing cybersecurity spending, with nearly half dedicating 8% or more of their IT budget to cyber. Governance is also strengthening, as 40% of firms now link CEO co...

Severity: Informational

Categories: Policy and Compliance, Security Operations

Read Full Article →

item.title: Expert Advice on Securing Critical Infrastructure with Limited Budgets
item.description:
In a recent podcast, cybersecurity expert Chetrice Romero from Ice Miller provided guidance for leaders responsible for protecting critical infrastructure, particularly those facing limited budgets. item.title: Atos Partners with Qevlar AI to Deploy "Virtual SOC Analyst"
item.description:
On October 7, 2025, the global digital transformation and cybersecurity firm Atos announced a strategic partnership with Qevlar AI. The collaboration will integrate Qevlar's 'Virtual SOC Analyst,' an agentic AI technology, into Atos's global network of 17 Security Operations Centers (SOCs). The goal...

Categories: Security Operations, Policy and Compliance

item.title: Digicloud Africa to Distribute Google's AI-Powered SecOps Platform Across Continent
item.description:
Digicloud Africa, a major Google Cloud distributor, announced on October 6, 2025, that it has partnered with Google Security Operations. This collaboration will make Google's advanced, AI-driven cybersecurity solutions, including its cloud-native SIEM and SOAR platform, available to enterprises and ...
